reviews.text: The periscope hotel is outstanding. Its service couldn't be any better, the staff is friendly, the people is friendly, the food is scrumptious, I couldn't think of a better place for a vacation, oh! did I mention that the food is great! If your ever into athens don't forget to checkout the periscope hotel. Experience the good things they have to offer.
reviews.title: Just what I needed

reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed 3 nights at Periscope. The hotel's unique scent is noticed as one is walking towards the building - clean and fresh! Our room was extremely comfortable for a small hotel. The neighbourhood has plenty of restaurants to try and Kolonaki is only a short walk away. The staff is extremely attentive and wiling to assist. Can't wait to visit again!
reviews.title: Ambiance in a great neighbourhood

reviews.text: Like the other reviewers we found the Periscope to have a cleansing new edge about it. From the scent of the front foyer to the Apavita products in the bathroom. The room we had was small but we can't complain because the location said it all. The outstanding merit for both his freshly made eggs to order and his local knowledge goes to morning chef Alexandros. Thanks heaps, everything worked well. Also Katerina, your morning smile said it all. Tips for Kolonaki: 1: wake up and climb Lycavitos Hill early in the morning and have the place to yourself - the view is insane. 2: Get yourself a magnificent designer treat from Sweet Alchemy down the road from the hotel by famous Greek pastry chef Stelios Parliaros. OMG we are still talking about it!!
reviews.title: Best eggs in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We sadly only stayed for one night on our way through Athens, but found the Periscope to be an extremely friendly and well run hotel. Modern, well designed rooms, nice restaurant for breakfast downstairs, well air-conditioned, very quiet street, lovely Apivita bathroom products. The best thing is the location - you are in a residential area with lots of interesting shops and restaurants that feels very safe to walk around. The Parthenon is within walking distance.
reviews.title: excellent boutique hotel in excellent location
Periscope
reviews.text: We took the Penthouse and were delightfully surprised . The view from the top floor is simply amazing , overlooking the Acropolis and with own jacuzzi , with timber decking . The apartment is very spacious with great amenities , including a great hair dryer . The staff were extremely helpful and courteous and kept our excess bags while we went Island hopping for 10 days , Nothing was too much trouble . Breakfast was lovely with freshly squeezed orange juice . Definitely would recommend this hotel to friends .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Periscope as our first stop in Athens. It is a great hotel for that first nap after the long flight because it has automatic metal roll-down window shades that make the room pitch black even in the middle of the day. The street is narrow and quiet. The location is safe and within walking distance of most everything you would want to see. The staff is very helpful and speaks excellent English.
reviews.title: Great little hotel
Superior staff but small rooms
reviews.text: The staff at Periscope could not be any nicer. The location was great - we walked just about everywhere and the one time we decided to take the subway it was only a short walk away. Breakfast was good but I must agree with another reviewer on everything seemingly counted...the amount of (sliced) fruit left me wanting more. I did feel a little cramped throughout our original four night stay. The fact that there is no real lobby or sitting area other than the restaurant added to that. When we came back to Athens for our final night's stay our request for a larger room was met and it made a huge difference in the ambience. Go for the larger room and you'll have an enjoyable stay...next time we'll know.
Overall, the Periscope hotel is a great place for staying in a very nice neighbourhood in Athens. At the same time, it might be slightly overpriced, in particular in view of the room size.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay in a great neighbourhood in Athens

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on a trip to Athens. I traveled by train from the airport (40 minutes) and It was a little difficult to find in the dark but I got there in the end. The hotel is a very small boutique hotel. The rooms are small but very functional. Good wifi connectivity throughout. Well sound proofed and is maintained to a very high standard. Breakfast is quite a small range but extremely good quality. The hot food cooked to order was delicious.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had lunch here once and wasn't that impressed. They advertise a Michelin chef, the person who served me was the same as who cooked breakfast. I found the lunch portion to take too long to cook, it came undercooked(!), the portion was small and not particularly tasty. This is why I've rated the hotel as 4 stars instead of 5.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: It's a 10-15 minute walk to the main shopping area and within a 5 minute walk is one of the tourist bus stops. I found it very easy to get around by foot.
reviews.title: Location,location,location

reviews.text: I'd be quite happy to stay here again. The staff were all so friendly and accommodating and really made my stay very pleasurable.
reviews.title: Periscope right in the heart of Kolonaki

reviews.text: Unfortunately, we only stayed one night at the hotel as it was excellent, we booked the penthouse suite which was brilliant, spacious, modern interior and great bubble bath with view at the rooftop. The staff is very helpfull and friendly, the rooms clean and breakfast was great. All in all a great place to stay and good value for money. It might not be in the top A location and doesn't have the view at the Akropolis but the hotel surely compensates for that and with the metro around the corner you can get to the Acropolis in 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Great experience

description: Periscope is a minimal city hotel with an impressive urban architecture, located on a quiet street, minutes away from Kolonaki square. The hotel draws its name from its electric periscope, a fantastic way to visit Athens from a distance! In the Lounge Bar, guests can find a remote control for a periscope located on the roof of the hotel. With a 360 degree range, the periscope's views, which guests select, are shown real time on a big plasma TV.
